greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest prime less than or equal to phi(n), a(1) = a(2) = 0.
comment: The original name was: "Prime preceding phi(n)". However, this is true only for n >= 7 from which onward phi(n) is guaranteed to get only composite values. For n = 3, 4 and 6 for which phi(n) = 2, a(n) = 2 also.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: a(1) = a(2) = 0 (by convention), and for n >= 3, a(n) = A007917(A000010(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2017
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Jan 09 2003
